Class Example

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.World
      • Example

  • public class Example
extends greenfoot.World
    This is an Example class that codes for the game of snakes and treasures Randomly placing snakes and treasures on the map if player digs up a treasure, they earn one point if player digs up a snake, they get a warning if player digs up a second snake, their score resets to zero player can skip their turns the round ends if each player skips their turn new round adds one more snake to the map, level of difficulties increases first player that reaches the win points wins players can choose whether they want to restart the game or not
    Version:
    10000000000000
    Author:
    Lu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Example()
      Constructor, constructs the world with the number of columns and rows with the constant cell size

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      the game.
      boolean checkClicked(int row, int column)
      returns true if the row and column had already been clicked, using constant FOUND
      boolean checkInt(java.lang.String x)
      check if the string is an integer
      boolean checkNew()
      shows the option of whether the player wants to restart the game or not.
      boolean checkPowerUp(int row, int column)
      returns true if it finds a snake at a given position of the 2-D array otherwise returns false
      boolean checkRound()
      returns true if the players dug up everything or every players skipped their turns otherwise returns false
      boolean checkSnake(int row, int column)
      returns true if it finds a snake at a given position of the 2-D array otherwise returns false
      boolean checkTreasure(int row, int column)
      returns true if it finds a treasure at a given position in the 2-D array, otherwise returns false
      boolean checkWin()
      check if the score exceeds the win points constant, return true if it is
      void clearSnake()
      clears the number snakes for each player
      void clearWorld()
      Clears the world by resetting all the values 0 in the 2-D array that stores all the values of snakes, treasures, and power-ups cleaning the background by drawing white squares to clear the background
      void constructWorld()
      constructing the game asking how many snakes and powerups the player wants making snakes, powerups, treasures based on the number the player is giving import the image to the background draws the player score, players turn, skip icon, difficulty
      void Difficulty()
      Draws the level of difficulty in the fourth cell of the last column
      void drawInitial()
      At the start of the game, it draws the player score in the last row
      void drawLastColumn()
      clears the last column of the world by drawing white squares
      void drawLastRow()
      clear the last row of the cell by drawing white squares
      void drawPower(int row, int col)
      Draws a picture of treasure
      void drawScore()
      draws the scores of the player
      void drawSkip(int row, int col)
      Draws a picture of treasure
      void drawSnakes(int row, int col)
      Draws a picture of a snake
      void drawSquare(int row, int col, greenfoot.Color color)
      Draws a colored square
      void drawText(int row, int col, java.lang.String str)
      Draw text in a given cell
      void drawTreasure(int row, int col)
      Draws a picture of treasure
      java.lang.String getScores()
      return the score of the game
      int highPlayer()
      returns the player with the higher score
      void ifWin()
      if one player wins, plays the music, reset all the variables allows player to choose whether they wants to restart a new game reset all the values in the 2-D arrays if player doesn't want to restart, end the game
      void makePower(int x)
      randomly making power ups based on the number given in the parameter if the position is already being used, re-randomize the position of powerups adding the power constant value to the 2-D array
      void makeSnake(int x)
      randomly making snakes based on the number given in the parameter if the position is already being used, re-randomize the position of snakes adding the snakes constant value to the 2-D array
      void makeTreasure(int x)
      randomly making treasures based on the number given in the parameter if the position is already being used, re-randomize the position of treasures adding the treasure constant value to the 2-D array
      void playerTurn()
      Draws which player's turn in the third cell of the last column
      void powerMusic()
      plays a certain music if the player dug up the powerups
      void powerTurn()
      score is added by 5 when the powerup has been dug by the player, using constant represent the score of the power draws the score of the player, moves on to the next player
      void Reset()
      reset the variables in the world 2-D array clears the board redraw the score of the players
      void showSkip()
      prints out the message about which player skipped their turn
      void skipTurn()
      allow players to skip their turn prints out the message about which player skipped their turn if all players skipped their turns, next round is started
      void snakeMusic()
      plays a certain music if the player dug up the snake
      void snakesLeft()
      Draws the number of snakes left in the second cell of the last column
      void snakeTurn()
      each player can't find more than one snakes, otherwise score goes back to zero if found a snake, number of snakes that player found is added
      boolean tieScore()
      returns true if the score is tied among the players otherwise returns false;
      void treasureMusic()
      plays a certain music if the player dug up the treasure
      void treasureTurn()
      score is added in the 2-D array if player has dug up a treasure draws the score of the player, moving on to the next player
      void winScore()
      draws the win score in the 5th cell of the last column

      • act

        public void act()
        the game. construct the world, prints out the number of snakes left, difficulty, which player's turn and win score on the screen check if wins at multiple situations check if the round is finished reset variables if the player wins or finised the round draw snakes, treasures, powers accordingly if player dug up does not allow players to click at one place more than once
